definition: to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to quarrel/to make a noise/noisy/to disturb by making a noise
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke

sentences.english: And your fussing makes not a particle of difference to the offender.
sentences.chinese: 而你的大吵大鬧又不會給冒犯者造成甚麼影響。

sentences.english: You can't be a basketcase, a girl who causes a scene or a girl who drinks too much.
sentences.chinese: 你不能一無是處，只知道大吵大鬧或喝得爛醉。

sentences.english: The couple next door are at each other's throats again. Shall we do something?
sentences.chinese: 隔壁那對夫妻又在大吵大鬧了，我們要去勸勸嗎？

sentences.english: BaiLing dissatisfaction jasper come hell down her anger after her away.
sentences.chinese: 柏齡不滿碧玉到來大吵大鬧，怒摑她後將她趕走。
大吵大鬧之後他們又扭打在一起。

sentences.english: Market reopen after a cessation of business, clients because buy, be less than aquatic product roughhouse.
sentences.chinese: 菜市場開市，顧客們因爲買不到水產大吵大鬧。

sentences.english: These kids ought to feel ashamed of themselves for such a free-for-all in public.
sentences.chinese: 這些孩子在大庭廣衆這樣大吵大鬧真是該感到害臊。

sentences.english: The young salesgirl rowed fiercely with the manager yesterday morning.
sentences.chinese: 昨天上午這位年輕的女售貨員與經理大吵大鬧。

sentences.english: I got into brawls in the country saloons near my farm.
sentences.chinese: 我在離我農場不遠的鄉下沙龍里和別人大吵大鬧。

sentences.english: Please don't make a scene in public places.
sentences.chinese: 請不要在公共場合大吵大鬧出洋相。

sentences.english: She said it was like the Titanic going down—people screaming and yelling.
sentences.chinese: 她說，像泰坦尼克號正在下沉，人們大吵大鬧。

sentences.english: Remember toddlers are allowed to throw tantrums. Parents are not.
sentences.chinese: 記住，小孩子可以大吵大鬧，但是父母卻不能。

sentences.english: When playing, he could not be interrupted without a creating a fuss.
sentences.chinese: 玩耍的時候，如果被打斷，他不可能不大吵大鬧。

definition: to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
loss of love/breakup of a relationship
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
spitting anger (idiom); in a rage
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to look anxious (idiom)/to look miserable
to get angry
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
proud and arrogant
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
